q: has prompted the first deep-soul searching at the company, which has faced few direct challenges up until now. Mr Eric Schmidt said that the company's three top executives had decided to "clarify" their roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. The company had always argued in the past that its unusual leadership arrangements worked well, and that it reflected the fact that Google was operated differently from most traditional companies. In a surprise move Eric Schmidt delivered the news as the company announced fourth-quarter profits that were far better than analysts had expected. Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! he tweeted as the results were released. Google reported a profit of$ 2.54 bn( Â£ 1.59 bn), up from$ 1.97 bn a year earlier, far better than expected.
